Articles.Content:
Does anyone know if there is a RSS pack scaled down to "Kerbin" size? I really want to explore our real planets, but it just seems like a big commitment to go all in with RSS+RO (gotta consider the memory aswell).

Edited August 14, 2015 by Red Iron Crown
I moved this post into its own thread so you can get better response.

Does anyone know if there is a RSS pack scaled down to "Kerbin" size? I really want to explore our real planets, but it just seems like a big commitment to go all in with RSS+RO (gotta consider the memory aswell).
There used to be one but I think it's defunct now that Kopernicus has replaced RSS. Anyway, RSS+RO isn't going to hit your memory constraint any more than a Kerbin-scale actual solar system will; you still need updated textures. Easiest option is to make a separate RO install and try things out.

There's also a config that is basically "Realism Overhaul Lite", you might want to look into that.

Edited August 14, 2015 by regex
There is on, it is called S^3 I think. I saw it on CKAN a few minutes ago.

There is on, it is called S^3 I think...

Release thread here
Thanks, I would have looked for it but I know it's on CKAN.
Ah, yes, S^3 by my good friend Niemand303 is exactly what you need.
